heading: Wednesday Night
text: Cloudy. Periods of snow, with 1 to 3 inches, up to 6 inches in the St. Lawrence Valley, Green Mountains, and Berkshires; chance of a squall late, mainly in the south. Lows from the mid teens to lower 20s, except single digits to lower teens in far northern New York. Southwest winds 5 to 15 mph, becoming northwest and gusting to 30 mph late.

heading: Thursday, New Year’s Day
text: Chance of early snow showers west of the Greens, likely east, then diminishing; otherwise clouds decreasing, doing so slowly northeast, with scattered mountain snow showers continuing there, before diminishing in the afternoon. Early highs from the single digits to mid teens north, and upper teens to mid 20s in the south, then temperatures steady of falling. West to northwest winds 5 to 15 mph, gusting to 30 mph.

heading: Thursday Night
text: Clear to partly cloudy. Lows in the single digits to around 10 above in the south, and in the Champlain Valley, zero to 10 below elsewhere north, except teens below in northeastern cold hollows. Northwest winds 5 to 10 mph, becoming light and variable.
